Job Description

Date

09/2021

Location

1300 Airport Road, North Brunswick NJ

Title

Vice President, Sales

Department

Sales

Reports to

Chief Executive Officer

FLSA (Exempt or Non-Exempt

Exempt

Role Overview

The Vice President of Sales is responsible for managing the Company’s sales functions in order to achieve sales and profit goals within their prospective region. This position will report directly to our EVP and be a part of the leadership team. This person will be responsible for business development, revenue growth and for achieving the approved annual sales plan in a cost-effective manner.

Areas of Responsibility
• Develop and implement strategic programs to ensure achievement of sales targets such as: increase in market penetration, gaining new business, and retention of customers.
• Develop a sales strategy (specific to each market being served) on a quarterly/annual basis to drive sales growth.
• Lead, motivate, and coach the sales team to meet and exceed sales revenue plans and provide the highest level of customer service.
• Assist and provide direct reports with career planning, training, and growth.
• Maintain a team-based work environment to promote sales across the business and drive employee and customer retention.
• Develop timely reports needed to monitor progress of sales team.
• Maintain and review sales prospect pipeline and sales forecast.
• Complete sales and negotiates contracts, as needed.
• Participate in fiscal year business planning.
• Conduct Quarterly Business Reviews with current customers, in conjunction with Account Executives, Account Managers (if applicable), and other designees to improve quality of service and unearth other avenues for opportunity.
• Keep current with industry standards and knowledge by attending trade shows, seminars, and conventions.
• Interface with senior management to accurately budget expenses and forecast future revenue, trending, and actual sales activity.
• Prepare and present proposals and presentations as needed to senior leadership.
• Present to ownership on monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.
• Track, manage and approve monthly sales incentives.
• Reviews market trends to determine customer needs, volume potential, price point, emerging technologies to develop sales strategy to accomplish growth goals of company.
• Review unprofitable products and develop plan with Sales and Operations to achieve profitable GP%.
• Represents company at trade association functions to promote product.
• Creates and controls expenditures of department to conform to annual budget requirements.
• Other Duties as Assigned.

Other Responsibilities Including Safety:
• Works in a safe and responsible manner in order to create an injury-free and incident-free workplace.
• Complies with all job-related safety and other training requirements.
Keeps management informed of area activities and of any significant problems.
• Requirements

Education & Qualification:
• 4 Year Bachelor’s Degree
• 10 years professional experience

Certifications, Licenses, Credentials:
• N/A

Skills & Ability
• Client-obsessed with a strong aptitude in a structured sales approach
• Self-motivated with exceptional talent in closing deals
• Strong knowledge in the complete end-to-end sales cycle (from prospecting to closing)
• Exceptional prospecting/hunter skills and experience
• Experience in pharmaceuticals and/or manufacturing environment is a plus
• Good communication and Email writing skills

Physical Requirements (lifting, etc.):
• Ability to navigate office, lab, and/or plant floor working environments.
• Standard office environment without unpleasant or hazardous conditions. Physical demands involved in office work such as the ability to talk, hear, use hands to handle and feel; work on a computer up to 7 hours a day; close vision required for computer usage.
• Must have the ability to wear applicable personal protective equipment utilized at this site, including safety glasses/goggles, hairnets, lab coats and safety shoes.

Work Environment (Office, Warehouse, temperature extremes, etc.):
• Exposed to lab and/or plant floor working environments.
• Standard office environment without unpleasant or hazardous conditions.
Temperature controlled for heat and air conditioning.
• The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the job responsibilities, duties, skill, or working conditions. In addition, this document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship.
